head.supplied: [Tamworth]. N.S.W ¶ 13/3/84. ¶ Dear Sir ¶ ¶ Your very kind note ¶ to hand and I forward by post the first small consignment of New England ferns. I shall be happy to forward from time to time any sp...

div.p: RB MSS M1, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.
MS annotation by M: 'Answ 21/3/84. F.v.M.' Letter not found. [Tamworth]. N.S.W

Your very kind note
Letter not found. to hand and I forward by post the first small consignment of New England ferns. I shall be happy to forward from time to time any specimens which I may think will interest you — I am preparing monograms of the New England Ferns. — I can manage the Drawings but find discriptions very difficult. I do not know the proper plan or method to adopt in discribing. It has struck me that the possition of the Spore Cases should be a good guide in identifying the various Species of Fern — Is there any Botanical work in which special attention is given to the "Filices" and if so could you give title of same. Perhaps I am doing work which has been already done Have any Monograms of the Australian Ferns been yet published? —

div.p: Please to refer to the No of each Specimen in Identifying as I have Duplicate Ferns & Numbers
